p: There is no strong evidence that dietary measures reduce the risk of TD [ 64]; however, common sense suggests that travelers should still be advised to follow the following precautions: Handwashing or use of alcohol gel after using the toilet and before eating, drinking bottled or boiled water, eating freshly cooked, piping hot food and peeled fruits, consuming pasteurized dairy products, avoiding salads, buffets, undercooked meat or seafood and food from street vendors unless cooked in front of the traveler, ensuring food it served hot and on clean cutlery [ 67].
